nameEntry.part: Local people's committee of the municipality of Gola

biogHist.p: Local People's Committee Gola was founded in 1945, based on the Law on Changing the Name of People's Liberation Committees (OG 3/1945). It is territorially competent in ​​Gola, Novačka, and Otočka. Actual jurisdiction and organizational structure are regulated by the General Law on People's Committees from 1946 to 1952. The higher administrative body for LPC Gola is the People's District Council Koprivnica.
Number of committee members: MNO Gola elected 33 members in 1947 and 1949, 17 from Gola, six from Otočka, and ten from Novačka.
There were five members with executive functions.

Purchase working group, Working group for communal affairs, Agricultural working group, Working group for workforce, Finance working group, Cultural and educational working group, Social and health working group, Working group for appeals and requests, Working group for national loan enrollment, Working group for threshing, Working group for procurement of fats, Working group for tax collection, and others.

The LPC Gola was abolished in 1952 by the Law on the Division of the People's Republic of Croatia into districts, cities, and municipalities (OG 16/1952) when the People's Liberation Committee Gola was established, incorporating all the villages of the LPC Gola and LPC Gotalovo.
